caption: Fingerprint
description: The Fingerprint object provides detailed information about a digital fingerprint, which is a compact representation of data used to identify a longer piece of information, such as a public key or file content. It contains the algorithm and value of the fingerprint, enabling efficient and reliable identification of the associated data.
name: fingerprint

algorithm.description: The hash algorithm used to create the digital fingerprint, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized hash algorithm, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.

1.caption: MD5
1.description: MD5 message-digest algorithm producing a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value.

2.caption: SHA-1
2.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 1 producing a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value.

3.caption: SHA-256
3.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value.

4.caption: SHA-512
4.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 512-bit (64-byte) hash value.

5.caption: CTPH
5.description: The ssdeep generated fuzzy checksum. Also known as Context Triggered Piecewise Hash (CTPH).

7.caption: quickXorHash
7.description: Microsoft simple non-cryptographic hash algorithm that works by XORing the bytes in a circular-shifting fashion.
